Pre-Game Insights: Burkina Faso and Malawi lock horns at the Stade du 26 Mars in neutral Mali on Tuesday for the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers.
Both teams are aiming for their first win of the campaign after dropping points in their respective openers.
Burkina Faso earned a point against Senegal with a stoppage-time equalizer by Ousseni Bouda.
Malawi lost 3-2 to Burundi despite an encouraging attacking display.
Burkina Faso have never lost in the fixture before.
Burkina Faso are ranked 67th in the world, while Malawi are ranked 126th.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Burkina Faso have gone unbeaten in all six previous clashes against Malawi.
Malawi have lost four of their five official games this year.
Burkina Faso are winless in their last eight official clashes, drawing three of their last four.
